summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating the review of image and video files from devices seized in the Epstein investigation. It includes a list of specific devices to be examined, references attached legal documents, and outlines a review protocol with a deadline.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: Sends an email on October 21, 2020, coordinating the image/video file review of seized devices, providing device lists and offering assistance.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sends an email on October 19, 2020, attaching the review protocol, search warrant documents, and the Maxwell indictment, and requests to coordinate a call with the review teams.

connections.description: They are coordinating the forensic review of evidence from the Epstein case, with the AUSA providing legal guidance and the FBI agent managing the operational review.

events.title: Review Protocol Distribution
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney distributes the image/video file review protocol for devices seized from Epstein, along with the search warrant, affidavit, and Maxwell indictment.

events.title: FBI Review Coordination
events.description: FBI Special Agent Amanda Young emails the team to coordinate the review of ten specific devices, aiming for completion by the following Friday.

events.title: Device Assignment Follow-up
events.description: An email follow-up reassigns device reviews among team members and proposes a team call to touch base on the progress.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were actively reviewing image and video files from at least ten specific electronic devices (e.g., NYCO24363, NYCO24394) seized in the Epstein investigation as of October 2020.
The review protocol required team members to read the associated search warrant, supporting affidavit, and the superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence indicates a coordinated effort between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force in New York.
A deadline was set to complete the initial review of the devices by the Friday following October 21, 2020.
